Reviews.Title: “It Was Fine but Not Special”
Reviews.Author: JudgeSusan
Reviews.Content: Location. Easy to find, Good access to everything. Unit. Kitchen appliances appeared brand new, furniture was comfortable and in good condition. One BR unit - the BR was small and cramped. King bed took up the whole room but bed was firm and comfortable. LR and kitchen were fine. Insufficient soap and towels. No housekeeping or linen exchanges unless you paid extra for it. We stayed a full week and felt we should have received at least one mid-week cleaning and linen replacement. Grounds. Lovely and well maintained. Two nice outdoor pools, grill/picnic area, sufficient parking. Amenities. Breakfast buffet & entertainment activity cost $9. The breakfast was fine but the "entertainment" consisted of tiny snippets from various Branson shows that were trying to get customers. We felt we had been misled into paying for 2 hours of commercials. Had we known this we would not have attended. Ticket sales. We checked around a lot for coupons and discounts, and found that we actually saved more by buying our tickets at the front desk. This was a surprise. Corey did a great job and got us excellent seats at all our shows. Traffic. Bumper to bumper until Monday, Labor Day, when everyone went home. After that the town was pretty empty.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Enkadtaw
Reviews.Content: Nice resort on the end of the Branson strip, room was better than expected, used timeshare week for a 2 bed/2 bath. Had a second floor view facing the pool, this helped with the Wi-Fi connection. Important when you have two teenagers, washer/dryer and kitchen were very nice and the kitchen had many appliances and utensils. Location was great because of the easy access to back streets so we didn't have to traverse through the main drag. Only complaint which we easily fought through was that one of the gas grills in the community area was not working properly. Minor problem to say the least. My smaller kids loved the playground, all of the family thought the pool areas were great as well. Really nice resort that I reccomend trying if you have the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: jwvandygrad
Reviews.Content: Although this resort was on the main strip, the condo buildings are set far enough back so you don't have loud traffic noise. It was peaceful and quiet. The rooms were clean, but the master bedroom is rather small. The pool was the perfect size - even in the evening when a lot of people were there, it did not feel too crowded. The only downside is that they do not have internet access in the rooms. They advised that internet is available at the pool and at the check in building. However, it only worked at the pool about 50% of the time. The walk back to the main building is quite an uphill hike, so we had to do without internet for most of our stay there. The location is very convenient to all the nearby attractions and within walking distance to several restaurants. The staff were friendly and the jetted tub was a very nice perk. Overall, we enjoyed our stay there, but would have preferred a place with Wi Fi in the guest rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: Lbailey911
Reviews.Content: What a terrific place! We had a very spacious 2 bedroom unit. It had a great kitchen, comfy living room area, and awesome jacuzzi bathroom. It was decorated very beautifully, the beds were comfortable, and it was clean. We were on the 4th floor, with elevator accesses. There was a washing machine and dryer in the unit. We had a great stay! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great place; will be back!”
Reviews.Author: chicadepearl
Reviews.Content: We booked this weekend through groupon. What an excellent deal! While the unit was a bit small, we had plenty of room to spread out. The kitchen was quite spacious compared to others I've been in and fully stocked. If you are going to spend more than one night, plan to bring laundry detergent. There is only one sink in the bathroom, but it has plenty of storage underneath. The jetted tub was nice and deep. I've seen other reviews complaining about lack of privacy. This was not our experience AT ALL! There is a locking door on the bedroom, and two locking doors in the bathroom (one that opens to the bedroom and one to the hallway). I didn't have a chance to visit the pools (2) while I was there, but they looked to have plenty of room. If I were traveling with my husband and two children (13 yr. old girl, 7 yr. old boy), I would want to get a two bedroom unit so they could have separate space. This would also allow me to put the hide-a-bed back up earlier so we would have a sitting area during the day. However, this is just a personal preference.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice accommodations, great amenities, a few oddities”
Reviews.Author: jeffcarp
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this condo a lot. The location is great. While the office sits on 76, the condos themselves are closer to Green Mountain Rd. There is a lot of Branson that is walkable from here IF you are healthy and fit. Anything you walk to from here involves a climb including to the office. Our family walked to the Titanic, Wax Museum and Butterfly Palace from here. A ton of restaurants can be walked to from here as well. The condo itself was a nice, well furnished 2 bedroom, 2 full bath. It was clean and in working order. The bed was comfortable. The second bedroom was a queen instead of 2 twins for kids but it was workable. The kitchen was well stocked and had modern appliances. The master bedroom was small but functional. Two small closets on each side of the bed were OK for 1 person to use. The master bath was huge with two sinks. One oddity was that the washer and dryer is in the master bath. That by itself was fine but the bathroom is not separated from the master bedroom. So using the washer and dryer or showering or getting ready will disturb your partner if they are trying to sleep later than you. We'd have preferred some pocket or french doors on the bathroom. The master bedroom has an LCD TV mounted on the wall without a DVD player. The living room has an older CRT TV but does have a DVD player. Because of the older televisions here nothing appears to be in high definition. However, the cable TV lineup is decent and it does include a movie channel. The grounds are nice. The two pools are clean and quite large. There is shuffleboard, ping pong and exercise equipment also. There are plenty of options for gas and charcoal grills on the grounds as well as places to eat outside. No concessions are served any where though, as expected. You would prepare it all yourself. There is WIFI available at the pool and at the clubhouse. Unfortunately, there is no Wi-Fi of any sort available in the units themselves which is disappointing. Sprint service was horrible at the complex, nonexistent inside the units and marginally OK in town.

Reviews.Title: “Clean location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: aznative6
Reviews.Content: On the strip do easy access to everything. We had 1 bedroom on 4th floor which had washer/dryer-best amenity. Only negative is closet way too small. Provide you with adequate housewares and plenty of coffee filters for the week we were there. Pool was very clean but would have preferred deeper water. Found this through RCI exchange. Would definitely reserve again.

Reviews.Title: “Branson Jewel”
Reviews.Author: Jpatbet
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 bedroom for 3 nights through the Armed Forces Vacation Club and what a bargain. This place exceeded all my expectations. What a clean and beautiful resort with easy access to all the shows. The 2 bedroom has a large living area with a dinning area,table & chairs for 6 people and kitchen w/bar like counter and stools.. Balcony that seats 4 has acesss to both the living area and to the large master bedroom which has a king bed w/large full bathroom and jacuzzi tub. 2nd bedroom is of medium size w/bathroom and shower.We had enough towels and dishes to support 6 people. This newer condo was super clean as well as the beautiful lanscapped grounds. Resort has 2 pools, one for children,and a playground.Main building has 2 available computers. Staff is very pleasant and well versed on area attractions. Discount tickets can be purchased for all the shows. I have rented a lot of nice resorts the past 10 years from AFVAC and this jewel exceeds all my past rentals.We were on a 15 day trip and I wish I had booked this place for a week. Believe me I will be back to enjoy this gem for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: buckranger
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at the French Quarter. It is at the end (or beginning) of Highway 76. So kinda nice to be out of the middle of Branson activity. We were in a 2 bedroom/2 bath downstairs unit. It was equipped with everything you need. It had a very large master bath with plenty of linens throughout. Flat screen tv's in both bedrooms and living room, stackable washer and dryer and a large dining table. The landscape is very well maintained, but this is not a gated entrance or exit complex. We were in a unit at the back of the property with quick access/entrance out of the complex. This would be a plus during peak times in Branson since traffic on 76 could be gridlock. We were there in somewhat an off season (early April) so some shows we're still closed. The Titanic exhibit was terrific, well worth the admission. Ninety minutes of very professionally layed out exhibit. Saw the Jim Stafford show, it was terrible with his two children doing 1/2 the show. He has been doing the show for 23 years and has a drone like quality. The Rib Crib was excellent on Tuesday with all you can eat pork ribs, service was great. A stroll along Branson Landing was also very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: redink46142
Reviews.Content: You say French Quarter, they say French Quater. When I first saw this misspelling on the phone covers in my room, I thought this lack of attention to detail would forecast a bad and disappointing stay. Thankfully, these typos were not a taste of things to come. The location and staff at French Quarter are excellent. Although the site is away from the hustle and bustle farther down the strip and in downtown, the main highway is at the front door, and an alternative route to avoid traffic is at the back door. It's quiet but close enough to all the shows, restaurants, and entertainment you might want to enjoy. French Quarter has several 4-story condo buildings, yet I did not receive any telemarketing calls during my stay. My 1-bedroom unit included a smallish bedroom with a full-size bed, small bathroom, and a kitchen/dining/living area. The space was more than enough for me to spread out and be comfortable during my visit, and I used the closet washer and dryer more than once. The furnishings were worn but clean and adequate. Because I was on the 4th floor, my unit included a large balcony that overlooked the hillsides of Branson. I especially enjoyed using the jets in the bathtub to relax after a long day of climbing, walking, and sightseeing around Branson. The closet in the bedroom was small, yet I had plenty of room for my items. Although the unit was advertised to sleep 4, two people would have slept in the bedroom and two people would have slept on the pull-out couch. It would have been uncomfortable but doable for four people to share the one small bathroom. The kitchen/dining room/living area would have been very comfortable for four people. Staff were very helpful and friendly. The gentleman who checked me in went out of his way to make me feel welcome, and Corey Engstrom at the ticket counter helped me find my way around. Internet access is not available in the units, but it is available until 10 pm at the main office. Every time I visited the office, the staff were friendly and helpful. Staying in a condo is always a bit tricky. Sometimes I'm uncertain whether I need to bring cooking utensils, sheets and towels, or paper goods. French Quarter provides cooking and eating utensils plus sheets and towels for 4. Paper goods are enough for one person for a little over a week, but you can purchase extra paper towels and toilet paper at the office. Shampoo and soap were included in the bathroom, but I'm glad that I bought along my own things. Dish soap and dishwasher soap were more than adequate, but the unit included only one packet of laundry soap. The primary reasons for my star rating are the lack of Internet availability in each unit; the need for some new furnishings; and the small size of the bedroom and bathroom. Yet these were offset by the great location, great staff, and peaceful atmosphere. When I return to Branson, I'll probably stay here again if the location meets the needs of myself and my travel party.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Dawn27reed
Reviews.Content: This was our second time. We love this place, nice and quiet and location off the main strip which is good. Rooms were comfortable for 2, kitchen and living room good size. Only thing missing was WiFi. You have to go to the check- in building to get internet. No calls for timeshare and no charge for maintenance. Excellent, would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: BaystateTravelers
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at The French Quarter in Oct., 2011. The location can't be beat as the back entrance is on the Yellow Route and literally 3 minutes from the back entrances of The Duttons, Caravell and Jim Stafford Theaters, making it very convenient to get anywhere, including the Jubilee grocery store. The Olive Garden and Cracker Barrell are an easy walk and the Red Route is just up the street. A bit of advice about room location. Our original room was on the first floor in building 6 and there was a very high concrete wall only 10' or 12' from the patio, giving it a very claustrophobic feel. The front desk staff was more than accommodating in moving us to a 3rd floor unit in building 3 where we had a nice balcony. All of the 1st floor units have a patio, although none were as closed in as building 3, and all other units in all of the buildings have a balcony. We've stayed in 3 different time shares in Branson and would definately return to the The French Quarter, but I would make sure we did not have a 1st floor. We had the one bedroom unit and it was clean and perfectly adequate for the two of us for our stay. The staff was friendly and very helpful. We purchased several show tickets from the concierge in the lobby and saved a few dollars on each. It was quick and easy and we had great seats.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: LarryLorenzo
Reviews.Content: Well located, gold crown resort. Contains about 8 condo buildings that appears to take up all their available real estate. Our 1 bedroom was comfortable but smaller that the typical gold crown 1 bdrm. Televisions had smaller screens than usual. Check In was very easy and pleasant. NO timeshare pressure at all. There was a timeshare 2 hour tour offer available on site for $125 in tickets for a DIFFERENT condo company/location. Show tickets sold on site appear well discounted. Almost all show tickets in the $30+ area. Location here a big plus since 1) Close to major intersection (entertainment/food) of "Shepherd of the Hills" and Route 76, 2) Across the road from Cracker Barrel, 3) Can easily use east/west "Green Mountain Road" or "Shepherd of the Hills" to avoid Hwy 76 traffic hangups. Don't forget Silver Dollar City ticket option to enter at 3:00pm for free (closes at 6:00 followed by evening show) on day before your full day ticket. If getting Showboat general admission tickets, ask for level 2, section BB on left or right side. The best level 1 seats are taken by bus groups. Food was so-so but 4 or 8:00pm show very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Right on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: xtcher03
Reviews.Content: We wanted a central location requiring little driving to shows and French Quarter was perfect. We had a one bedroom, very tiny at less than 600 sq. ft. which prompted my 4 stars instead of 5. Everything else was perfect. We had a newer unit on the ground floor, very clean, with everything provided in a condo week's rental. The staff was exceptional, and we were on our own all week, as desired. Next time I will book the 2-bedroom at 1160 sq. ft. as the extra cost will be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “very nice!”
Reviews.Author: annie5959
Reviews.Content: Got a walk-in price of 75.00 for a 1 bedroom with full kicthen, near pool! The condo was near nice restrarunts and could quickly get on the yellow route, which is faster than going threw 76H. Free wifi and parking. Only stayed one night , but will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: bigG91
Reviews.Content: The Hotel/Condo was very clean, the view from the room is not the greatest. The pool was very clean & staff was very freindly. The ticket guy at the front desk was very knowledgeable & helpful with the shows we wanted to see.

Reviews.Title: “We had an excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Doneitall
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect but was very pleasantly surprised. The room was very clean, well appointed with refrigerator, stove, oven, microwave and dishwasher. A TV in the sitting room as well as in the bedroom with the queen sized bed. A view of the pool gave us WIFI access in our room (advertised as only available in the pool area or the front lobby/check-in area). Nice balcony area, two pools (kiddie and full-size) with two hot tubs. Front staff was very accommodating. Overall and excellent value. We were on the third floor of building 5.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful acomodations!”
Reviews.Author: karsuebub
Reviews.Content: We were VERY pleased with the condo. It was spotless! (except for a round white {clorox?} stain on the carpet) Everything was in top notch condition. Furniture was in excellent condition. Kitchen just perfect! AND the knives were SHARP! Didn't know that was possible in a condo on vacation.....we always bring at least one sharp knife! What's with NO WIFI?! That was so not cool! However, the condo we were in, 142 I think, was able to pick up the wifi from the office if we sat close to the patio door so for us it wasn't a huge deal. And bathrooms really do need doors people! At least for the toilet. As one reviewer said, even married couples need a little privacy at times. But all in all I would give these facilities an extremely high rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Condo”
Reviews.Author: MSHT
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a 1 bedroom unit with my two college aged kids for a week. The condo was clean and well stocked. The bedroom was small but that was not a concern for us. Staff was friendly and helpful. The pool was clean and extra towels were available at the pool. Bar-b-que grills were available for use by the pool area. There was an exercise room, shuffleboard and a playground area. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: JWM-AR
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a 2 bedroom unit. It was very spacious and very, very nice. We loved it and plan on staying there again this coming December if we can get it booked.

Reviews.Title: “Timeshare Jewel”
Reviews.Author: gapeachwinder
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best timeshare we've been to. Staff so friendly and attentive. Rooms with beautiful furnishings. Grounds beautiful. Location is great especially when traffic in Branson gets heavy. Our unit was a 3-bedroom with lockout - would sleep 12 but we only had six. We will definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet Oasis in a Busy Town”
Reviews.Author: mrrickbear
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the French Quarter from April 11th until April 17th. The French Quarter is a collection of four-story buildings on well-manicured grounds. Scattered about were picnic tables and barbecues for use by guests. Check-in was quick, and the staff very pleasant. Included in our check-in materials was even a flyer about nearby storm shelters. We stayed in Unit 131B. Very nice! And spacious! It was a two-bedroom, two-bath unit, well furnished. There was a stacking washer/dryer, dishwasher, and all the appliances you need – coffee maker, blender, microwave – full, well-appointed kitchen. The refrigerator had an ice-maker. Dishwasher soap was under the sink. There were TVs in the living room and each of the bedrooms, and a king-sized bed in each bedroom. The master bath had a separate corner shower and large corner jetted tub, which would easily accommodate two people. Mirrors surround the jetted tub – a good reminder to go easy on the buffets! The master bath also had two sinks. A hair dryer is fastened right on the bathroom mirror – no hair dryer checkout. The second bathroom had two doors – one from the living area and one from the second bedroom. The couch contained a fold-out bed. This unit had a door in the living area that looked liked it opened up to an adjoining unit, which would make it a good choice for two families vacationing together. The unit was immaculate. The living area had a sliding door that opened up onto a covered balcony, which was furnished with a set of wicker furniture – a loveseat, two chairs, and a table. This balcony was also accessible from the master bedroom. We looked out onto greenery, not a parking lot. There is a Wal-Mart and a Jubilee grocery store are about a mile and a half or two miles straight down the same road. While we shopped for a few groceries, we also picked up some extra toilet paper and some clothes detergent. Across the street is a Cracker Barrel. Next door is an Olive Garden. There was a transportation and ticket service -- Tours by Terry, I believe -- that transported people to several different shows each day if they didn’t care to drive. The same business brought tickets right to my door for a show. We understood that a new service was being set up where the resort would be able to print your show tickets right at the resort. A big thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Only resort on 76!”
Reviews.Author: GarysgirlMaryland12
Reviews.Content: Booked this vacation as a getaway with RCI. Great location. Our one bedroom unit was nicely decorated and had very good quality furniture. I really liked the wrought iron dining room chairs and the wrought iron and glass dining room and living room tables. The staff was very helpful and efficient especially John, the manager, who gave me very good directions to the resort via cell phone while we were driving from the airport. If you are flying to Branson as we did, try out the new Branson airport which opened in May 2009. This airport is closer than the Springfield airport. We love to travel and always want to save money. Try out the winery tour, which is free. The Ride the Ducks was only $20 per person, and the Duck picked up a group of guests from the resort. Branson is the live entertainment capital of the world, so you have to see the shows. Many sources would suggest you buy your tickets online before arriving to Branson or at the airport upon arrival. We did neither. We were able to see three free shows and received $100 in cash in return for attending two timeshare presentations. If you don't mind sitting through the presentations, this may be an option for you. Timeshare salespeople approached me at the Apple supermarket and at the outlet mall. It was hard to believe we were visiting during a red week. The resort was very quiet. Branson is great for families and for the older crowd (we are in our 40s and 50s.) Two computers were available in the business center for free internet usage. French Quarter provides plenty of free parking for its guests. On our last day we discovered all-day free entertainment on 76 at the Branson Mall. I would recommend this resort to anyone traveling to Branson.

HotelInfo.Name: French Quarter
HotelInfo.Address: 3706 W 76 Country Blvd, Branson, MO 65616
